title: What is Artificial Intelligence?
content: Artificial Intelligence (AI) refers to the simulation of human intelligence in machines that are programmed to think and learn like humans. The term may also be applied to any machine that exhibits traits associated with a human mind, such as learning and problem-solving.

title: Understanding Machine Learning
description: Basics of machine learning and its types.
content: Machine Learning is a subset of AI that enables a system to automatically learn and improve from experience. It focuses on the development of computer programs that can access data and use it to learn for themselves. The three main types are supervised learning, unsupervised learning, and reinforcement learning.

title: Introduction to Neural Networks
description: Exploring the structure of neural networks.
content: Neural networks are a series of algorithms that mimic the operations of a human brain to recognize relationships between vast amounts of data. They are used in deep learning and for the purposes of clustering and classification.

title: AI in Everyday Life
description: Examples of AI in daily life.
content: AI is increasingly prevalent in our everyday lives. It appears in a variety of forms including virtual assistants, chatbots, recommendation systems, autonomous vehicles, and more. Each of these systems uses AI to interpret and respond to data in a way that mimics human decision making.

title: Ethics in AI
description: The importance of ethics in AI development.
content: Ethical considerations in AI involve issues like privacy, security, decision-making biases, job displacement, and more. As AI systems take on more decision-making roles, the ethical framework guiding their development and deployment becomes increasingly important.
